intro: Pelargonium emancipatum, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Pelargonium emancipatum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
